channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed

item.title: You Can Now Install—and Update—Microsoft Store Apps Using the Command Line
item.description: By typing simple, text-based commands into Windows' PowerShell, you can quickly install apps directly from the Microsoft Store—all without the typical ads or clutter.

item.title: Test du Panasonic Lumix FZ82D : un bridge pas cher à zoom 60x pour capturer l’impossible
item.description: Le Panasonic FZ82D est un bridge ultra-polyvalent qui promet de capturer des sujets inaccessibles grâce à son zoom optique x60. Avec une plage focale équivalente de 20 à 1200 mm, cet appareil compact et abordable s'adresse aux photographes amateurs qui veulent repousser les limites de la photographie sans se ruiner. Mais le FZ82D demande d'accepter de sérieux compromis. ...

item.title: Ce pack smartphone + écouteurs OnePlus à moins de 300 € devient le meilleur rapport qualité-prix du moment
item.description: OnePlus propose un bundle complet incluant son milieu de gamme, le Nord CE5, avec des écouteurs sans fil ainsi qu'un chargeur de 80 W, le tout pour 289 euros au lieu de 487 euros au départ. De quoi bien s'équiper sans se ruiner en ce début d'année 2026.

item.title: iRestore Elite Laser Hair Growth System Review: Surprisingly Effective
item.description: After just two months, my husband saw enough hair regrowth that his college friends commented on it.

item.title: After the 2026 Winter Olympics, Figure Skating Will Never Be the Same
item.description: From disappointments to scandals to Madison Chock and Evan Bates’ silver medal, figure skating brought some of the biggest surprises of the Milano Cortina Games. We talked to Adam Rippon to find out why.

item.title: « Bordel, la Chine est en train de gagner » : cette journaliste essaye la Xiaomi SU7 électrique et ne veut plus conduire sa Ford Mustang
item.description: Après avoir passé deux semaines au volant de la Xiaomi SU7 électrique, une journaliste américaine du Wall Street Journal tire un constat sans appel : l'industrie automobile occidentale accuse un retard technologique flagrant face aux constructeurs chinois.

item.title: I tested every Kindle to find the absolute best Amazon e-reader
item.description: To find the best Kindle for your library, Mashable tested and reviewed Amazon's latest e-readers. Compare the Kindle, Kindle Kids, Paperwhite, and Scribe.

item.title: ‘Narco-Submarine’ Carrying 4 Tons of Cocaine Captured by Mexico's Navy
item.description: Following increased surveillance and patrols of routes used by transnational drug-trafficking networks, Mexican authorities have seized approximately 10 tons of cocaine in the past week alone.

item.title: My first love, The Legend of Zelda, turns 40 today — here's why I think the series has survived and thrived
item.description: The Legend of Zelda has stood the tests of time (quite literally, in-game), but there's a lot more to its success than might meet the eye...

item.title: Why using facial recognition on your phone could leave you vulnerable
item.description: Journalists and activists aren’t the only ones who can have their biometrics used against them. Here’s how to protect yourself. Biometric authentication—the ability to unlock your devices by using just your face or fingerprint—is one of the few smartphone features that, even today, leave me feeling like we’re living in the future. When I was a kid, technology like facial recognition was limited to science fiction. But as cool and useful as biometric authentication is, the technology can also leave us vulnerable. Here’s why—and how to protect yourself....

item.title: Sony’s first clip-style buds sound fabulous, but is that enough to justify their price?
